result.execSummary:
The defendant Tonya M Veenstra was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Tonya M Veenstra is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Tonya M Veenstra was found guilty of Possession of Cocaine/Coca(2nd+), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(c).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Letter from defendant regarding financial obligations, traffic school, and license suspension

Defendant Tonya M Veenstra in court, in custody with attorney Amanda K. Riek.  Troy D Cross appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Court went over the rights & elements. Defendant plead no contest to count one in 14CF372. Court found defendant guilty, entered judgment, sentence withheld, 2 yr. probation, 30 days jail, start date to be set at review hearing (in six months) huber granted, to be served within first 9 months of probation, $518 costs, submit DNA sample, Complete AODA and comply with all treatment recommendations, review hearing to be held in 6 months. Defendant plead guilty in 14TR7189, $761.50 fine, 60 days to pay, complete AODA, follow all treatment, 1 yr. IID, 6 mo. revocation. Court granted 4 days jail credit. Other traffic tickets dismissed. In 14CF372, cts. 2&3 dismissed. Cash bond applied to TR case.
with Petition for Writ of Habeas Corpus to Will County adult detention facility for 12-30-14 at 2:45 pm.
